page.title: 01Our Area - A General View
page.content: This block contains mostly hill land, surrounding the sea inlet of Balta Sound and containing most of the settlement of{ Baltasound.}The housing is scattered apart from three Council estates and a small private estate for pilots at the airport. Most land is used for crofting, mostly sheep grazing with some rearing of Shetland ponies, as well as the growing of potatoes, cabbage, turnips and grass for hay. The main feature of the area is the{Airport}which serves the oil rigs in the North Sea to the N.E. of Unst in the Ninian Field. The area has 3 general stores, one with a bakery and petrol pumps, a butcher's and a Post Office. There is a church and a public hall which is used for badminton, dances, concerts and weddings. There are many ruined crofts showing how the population has fallen.
